file_content.text: This is close enough. And there's the Gilded Star, just like I promised.
"Gold-plated" and "stealth ship" don't exactly line up. Now we just have to hope mommy dearest remembers her daughter's birthday.
I can kill you from here, Gault.
Great, really getting into the spirit of your character. At least, from what I hear.
We are approaching the checkpoint. No further communications are warranted until the bridge is under our control.
Roger. Break a leg, ladies. It's in their hands now. All we've got to do is wait.
Once they open the way for us, all we have to do is get this bomb inside the vault?
Let's go over my part again.
Assuming everything goes according to plan.
You think Senya is really cut out for this sort of role?
She's out of her element.
Doesn't matter, she's the only one with a shot at it.
But hey, if something has to go horribly wrong, now's the best time. For us anyway.
We're not leaving anyone behind, Gault.
Not funny.
Only kidding, I'd never abandon a close personal associate in their time of need.
He was an idiot.
What about that thing with Kai?
I honestly can't tell if that's optimism.
That's still pretty bad.
Oh sure, I'd be less than thrilled to have my perfect shot at ludicrous affluence botched by rank amateurs, but live to filch another day and all that.
Worst case scenario, what happens?
What's your backup plan?
There's a dock full of transports and haulers right that way. Not a coincidence, I assure you.
So, how did you manage to fleece Lana at cards anyway?
About that sabacc game....
You've got a pretty good handle on all that Force nonsense. What would you do if you were at the sabacc table?
Read my opponent, try to pick up their thoughts and emotions.
Find what you're thinking.
Exactly.
Predict the cards that will come up and play accordingly.
Peek into the future.
Pfft. If you're only thinking about your next draw, you've already lost.
Sweep it clean with the force and make my way to the exit.
Levitate it out the door.
Crush your feeble throat and claim the prize.
Take what I want.
Reassuring. I'll remember that when we're dividing shares, pal.
Just because your opponent has a sixth sense doesn't mean you can't use it distract them.
I could tell Lana was trying to peek inside my head, so I just made sure she got an eyeful.
The angry glares she flashed were easier to read than anything I was doing. As for the rest, well, trade secrets, you know.
Turning her advantage into yours, clever.
Impressive.
Come on, we're partners now, no secrets between us.
But I want the whole story.
When I've got enough credits to buy half the galaxy, maybe we'll talk.
You kept your mind in the gutter to counter her perception of the Force? You're full of it.
I don't believe you.
Care to give it a try?
[Call His Bluff]
Gah, what is wrong with you?
I'll take your word for it.
No.
When you make your living in the galaxy's cess pits, it never hurts to be able to sink lower than the competition.
I am now in complete control of the Gilded Star's network. I will isolate the vessel's sentinels to the best of this system's ability.
Show time.
I picked out a discreet vantage point near the skyhook. Better get in position.
I was expecting shinier.
Shut up.
True.
